intro: Schizoglossum elingue, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces clusters of small, brightly colored blooms. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth. Schizoglossum elingue is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
